title: The Spider and the Bird
body:
I need Varys to see Sansa at work, and realize how good she’s at this. I need him to regret not helping her in King’s Landing and not protecting her from Baelish. Also, JONSA VIBES.

Does anyone has a fic from his POV, re-meeting Sansa? That would be GREAT!

summary: have you seen the theory that sansa has empathy magic? if so i’d like to know your opinion on it
question: have you seen the theory that sansa has empathy magic? if so i’d like to know your opinion on it
answer:
Dear nonny,

I’m not sure tbh. On the one hand Sansa has lots of empathy and her empathy clearly influences people, even some as brutal as the Hound. But on the other hand empathy magic is not really part of the magical system in Westeros - although I must admit it is most of the times a pretty vague system.

I do think that she has one of the magics of the CotF. Jon and Arya have warging, Bran greenseeing, and Sansa singing. The singing that is the kind of magic that moves peoples emotions:

“Old Nan says the children knew the songs of the trees, that they could fly like birds and swim like fish and talk to the animals,” Bran said. “She says that they made music so beautiful that it made you cry like a little baby just to hear it.“  (AGOT, Bran VII)  

You probably could call this empathy magic, but I prefer to identify this as the magic of song and singing - not only that is sounds much more ‘magical’ but also for the wonderful Sansa/Luthien parallel. Sansa as Luthien fits so well to Jon as Beren, that you would have to snatch Sansa as a singer of magical songs who sings Jon’s soul back into life by singing “Florian and Jonquil” to him from my cold dead hands.

And I think we haven’t yet see the full force of her magic, because we’ve only witnessed the incident with the Hound after the Blackwater and nothing else yet.

Thanks for the ask!

title: From Bad to Worse
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2AOJFaL

by Dexidoodle

Modern Westeros AU.
Borrowed GRRMs characters but story is totally unrelated. Might have violence and liberal use of bad words… and the potential for a little citrus (though citrus is not my strong point)
This is my first attempt at SanSan, first post on AO3 and it’s unbeta’d (triple threat). I’m not very good at writing, it won’t be very good. :P

Anyway, I’m terrible at descriptions. Read it, if you like it, woohoo, if not… meh.

summary: I just saw maise's instagram. and it is true there is a photo that she posted after finish shooting and one of the hashtag says...
question: I just saw maise's instagram. and it is true there is a photo that she posted after finish shooting and one of the hashtag says #lastwomanstanding. in the show already are few women. and that phrase does not leave much to the interpretation. I think that maise gave us a spoiler without wanting to :(. It won't be the first time that she does it.
answer:
Dear nonny,

I don’t remember another time where she gave something away though? And tbh this insta post could mean that she was just the last woman that filmed? I don’t really believe that all the women die. That would be ridiculuos.

I wouldn’t read too much into it. Actors and actresses earn their living by pretending to be other people. Any information that comes through the actors before the series is ended has to be taken with a huge grain of salt.

And as I said, she could hint at her stamina in filming, at her being the last to finish, at her being in the last scene (which wouldn’t mean anything). No, dear nonny, don’t fret. Sansa won’t die.

Thanks for the ask!

summary: Sansa Stark has always been a bad ass from the very beginning…
title: Sansa Stark has always been a bad ass from the very beginning…
body:
She was in enemy territory and her father just got murdered yet what does she say to Joffrey when he tells her he’ll behead her brother too…

There’s a battle taking place, everyone’s afraid yet Sansa has the time to troll Joffrey for being too much of a coward to fight in the Battle of King’s Landing and tries to trick him into going into the battlefield…

My favourite… when she uses her amazing courtesy to diss Joffrey and Tyrion…

and Tyrion was all like…

That time when she used her incredible acting skills to protect Littlefinger and herself after Lysa’s murder thereby winning the trust of everyone at the Vale…

When she agreed to marry Ramsey Bolton (the family that murdered her mother and brother) to win back Winterfell and told Myranda (Ramsey’s crazy psychotic girlfriend)…

When she was being repeatedly raped and abused by Ramsey but still wasn’t afraid to speak out…

When she tries to escape but gets caught by Myranda…

When she helps Jon find armies to win back Winterfell and the North…

When she tells Ramsay that he’s going to die…

When it seemed like they were going to lose the battle but she rides in with the Army of the Vale to save the day…

and then proceeded to feed her crazy psychotic husband to his dogs…

She plays Littlefinger (the best schemer known to Westeros)  and then executes him…

Yep Sansa Stark is a …

and the most important reason why she is so strong is because despite all the hardships she’s been through, she still shows kindness towards people…

title: The Warrior's Test
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2CvSmH4

by Vermilion_Sunrise

Westerosi AU / SanSan: When the Warrior lays his eyes on Sansa Stark he is filled with lust for the young maiden. But only how to have her? In order to seduce the girl he must first find a human form, but that’s only half of his problems.

Fashioned after old greek myths, this story should be an easy courtship story in which Sandor is not quite himself some of the time.

Words: 1549, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Sandor Clegane, Sansa Stark, The Warrior (ASoIaF), The Maiden (ASoIaF)
  • Relationships: Sandor Clegane/Sansa Stark, Sandor Clegane & Sansa Stark
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, Mythology - Freeform, ASoIaF Mythology, The Warrior’s Test, Keeping your dick in your pants, Wooing, a maiden, Sandor isn’t quite himself, How Hard Can It Be?, He’ll only have to fight a bear, Courtship of a different kind

Westerosi AU / SanSan: When the Warrior lays his eyes on Sansa Stark he is filled with lust for the young maiden. But only how to have her? In order to seduce the girl he must first find a human form, but that’s only half of his problems.

Fashioned after old greek myths, this story should be an easy courtship story in which Sandor is not quite himself some of the time.

Words: 1549, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Sandor Clegane, Sansa Stark, The Warrior (ASoIaF), The Maiden (ASoIaF)
  • Relationships: Sandor Clegane/Sansa Stark, Sandor Clegane & Sansa Stark
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, Mythology - Freeform, ASoIaF Mythology, The Warrior’s Test, Keeping your dick in your pants, Wooing, a maiden, Sandor isn’t quite himself, How Hard Can It Be?, He’ll only have to fight a bear, Courtship of a different kind


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2CvSmH4

summary: Why is it that people hate on scared/emotional kids in any fictional story where every adult is cruel to them and they’re being...
body:
Why is it that people hate on scared/emotional kids in any fictional story where every adult is cruel to them and they’re being forced to go through some traumatic shit not even an adult could ever recover from??? 
They see these kids get humiliated/ abused / gaslighted / etc. And still be like “”oh my god, stop being such a crybaby’!””” ?????????

summary: Sunday Six: Sansa Stark is Sansa Holmes
title: Sunday Six: Sansa Stark is Sansa Holmes
body:
… and Arya is Watson in “The murder of Prime Minister Jon Arryn“ .

Digging up an oldie crossover here I’d like to come back to. Could need some help, though. ;-)


“Well, I got only back after midnight, so it was indeed a long evening, sister.”

“And what followed took even longer, didn’t it?” Arya chuckled and winked.

Sansa straightened, answered: “Uh, that’s private, dear.”

She got her weirwood pipe out of her bag and started to smoke, unwilling to say any more.

Arya, however, couldn’t help herself and commented: “Mmmh, let’s just say I was surprised you suddenly discovered something appealing behind his ugly façade. And in spite of his acid tongue. Well, I guess he used that tongue of his for some more positive things last night.”

blog.description: Fantasy aficionado since I read Tolkien in my teenage years. I still love Tolkien but I am also into other works. I love ASOIAF (books) and GoT (Show). I also like Brandon Sanderson, Lois McMaster Bujold, in short in my free time it's fantasy...Header by courtesy of ragekitn!

summary: Hi there! I need some reassurance and your wonderful positivity. The ONE thing that has always made me think Sansa might die...
question: Hi there! I need some reassurance and your wonderful positivity. The ONE thing that has always made me think Sansa might die before the end is Lady. So every Stark who lost a wolf didn't live. Then I saw someone suggest Sansa will die in the same way as her wolf - sacrificing herself for Arya. This really scares me because I can totally see it happening. On top of that, Maisie posted a "Last woman standing" on her Insta awhile ago. I can't watch if Sansa dies. What do you think?
answer:
Dear nonny,

I could give you a very long answer to this, but I just alert you to a series by @lostlittlesatellites (here, here and here).

But to give you also a short answer: If Lady’s death was a foreshadowing of Sansa’s death you would have to ask, how she survived 7 seasons without Lady, when Robb and Grey Wind died almost simultaneously.

The death of Lady has several reasons, some of them are Doylist reasons, some of them in-world. Lady is buried in Winterfell and this is an early hint that Sansa will return to Winterfell and that this is her home. Bran awakes after Lady is killed. This might be an example of magic, of ‘death pays for life’. It is hinted at in the books just be the order of how things happen, in the show it is heavily hinted at, because at the end of episode 2, Bran opens his eyes the moment Lady dies. In a way, Sansa’s arc is also about the death of her inner lady, the trusting child that thought “life is a song.” Sansa sheds this persona with every further step she takes until she will be a Queen, but she won’t have lost her kindness and other ‘ladylike’ characteristics.It is more of a transformation from Lady to Queen than a full-blown change.

From a doylist perspective Lady needs to die so that Sansa won’t have a protector in King’s Landing and her death is used by GRRM to drive a wedge between her and her sister and to alienate Sansa from her father. It is also a means to show us, how dangerous Cersei is. I think Lady’s death is also a means to hide the fact that Sansa has some magic of her own. I’m not sure I believe the theory that part of Lady lives on in her, but I am certain that Sansa has the magic of singing. This will be very important once she reunites with Jon in the books, as I have explained in my Beren and Luthien meta (here is the link to the third part) and my meta on “singers singing songs” (the part on Sansa is here).

So, there are in-world and doylist reasons for Lady’s death and none of them are connected to Sansa dying. People who predict Sansa’s death are usually people who are still stuck in the opininon they shaped from Arya’s first chapters in AGOT - chapters that strongly convey the ‘Cinderella’s awful step-sisters’ vibes, and that are misleading the readers. This leads them to the opinion that Sansa somehow ‘has to pay’ and consequently sacrifice herself for Arya. You wouldn’t believe some of the punishments Sansa haters manage to come up with! Sacrificing herself for Arya is one of the nicer ones…. As if there weren’t many, many much more nasty people in ASOIAF that GRRM would waste his time to punish one sister for the squabbles of children.

I don’t believe that there is even the slightest chance that this will happen. Sansa is not the mean step-sister, but only readers who are ready to read her chapters carefully can disentangle themselves from the tropes GRRM cleverly put into place in AGOT.

No, Sansa and Arya will live:

The night the bird had come from Winterfell, Eddard Stark had taken the girls to the castle godswood, an acre of elm and alder and black cottonwood overlooking the river. The heart tree there was a great oak, its ancient limbs overgrown with smokeberry vines; they knelt before it to offer their thanksgiving, as if it had been a weirwood. Sansa drifted to sleep as the moon rose, Arya several hours later, curling up in the grass under Ned’s cloak. All through the dark hours he kept his vigil alone. When dawn broke over the city, the dark red blooms of dragon’s breath surrounded the girls where they lay. “I dreamed of Bran,” Sansa had whispered to him. “I saw him smiling.”    (AGOT, Eddard V).

After the long Night, Sansa and Arya will be alive, Bran probably as well, even though maybe he’ll be a tree ofr in some ‘dream’ situation, and maybe even Jon will live (dragon’s breath).

I hope to have dispelled your doubts!

Thanks for the ask and thanks for the compliments!

blog.name: bighound-littlebird
blog.title: The SanSan Safe Haven
blog.description: We strive to make this a quality Sansan blog free of hate for book and show fans alike. Our goal is to provide inspiration and quality sansan art, fanfiction recommendations , edits, meta, discussion, confessions, head canons and prompts for you.♡ We tag NSFW content. Header gif by @kingsleigh

summary: “Ser Harrold looked down at her coldly. “Why should it please me to be escorted anywhere by Littlefinger’s bastard?” All three...
body:
“Ser Harrold looked down at her coldly. “Why should it please me to be escorted anywhere by Littlefinger’s bastard?” All three Waynwoods looked at him askance. “You are a guest here, Harry,” Lady Anya reminded him, in a frosty voice. “See that you remember that.” A lady’s armor is her courtesy. Alayne could feel the blood rushing to her face. No tears, she prayed. Please, please, I must not cry. “As you wish, ser. And now if you will excuse me, Littlefinger’s bastard must find her lord father and let him know that you have come, so we can begin the tourney on the morrow.” And may your horse stumble, Harry the Heir, so you fall on your stupid head in your first tilt. She showed the Waynwoods a stone face as they blurted out awkward apologies for their companion. When they were done she turned and fled. Near the keep, she ran headlong into Ser Lothor Brune and almost knocked him off his feet. “Harry the Heir? Harry the Arse, I say. He’s just some upjumped squire.” Alayne was so grateful that she hugged him.”

The Winds of Winter, Alayne

The Winds of Winter, Alayne
trail.content:
“Ser Harrold looked down at her coldly. “Why should it please me to be escorted anywhere by Littlefinger’s bastard?” All three Waynwoods looked at him askance. “You are a guest here, Harry,” Lady Anya reminded him, in a frosty voice. “See that you remember that.” A lady’s armor is her courtesy. Alayne could feel the blood rushing to her face. No tears, she prayed. Please, please, I must not cry. “As you wish, ser. And now if you will excuse me, Littlefinger’s bastard must find her lord father and let him know that you have come, so we can begin the tourney on the morrow.” And may your horse stumble, Harry the Heir, so you fall on your stupid head in your first tilt. She showed the Waynwoods a stone face as they blurted out awkward apologies for their companion. When they were done she turned and fled. Near the keep, she ran headlong into Ser Lothor Brune and almost knocked him off his feet. “Harry the Heir? Harry the Arse, I say. He’s just some upjumped squire.” Alayne was so grateful that she hugged him.”

The Winds of Winter, Alayne
